summary:
The Security Council:
- Welcomes international efforts to provide technical assistance to Afghanistan and encourages cooperation among institutions.
- Calls on the Afghan Government to continue public administrative reform and anti-corruption efforts.
- Welcomes the 10-year justice reform strategy and invites the Afghan Government to work towards a fair and transparent justice system.
- Calls for full respect for human rights and international humanitarian law, and requests UNAMA to assist in implementing human rights provisions.
- Welcomes the Action Plan on Peace, Justice and Reconciliation and encourages international support.
- Welcomes the Afghanistan National Development Strategy (iANDS) and calls on the Afghan Government to provide strong leadership in its implementation.
- Recognizes the risk posed by opium cultivation, production and trafficking, and welcomes the updated National Drug Control Strategy.
- Emphasizes the role of the Joint Coordination and Monitoring Board in monitoring the implementation of the Compact.
- Welcomes the proposal to extend the reach of regional offices, security permitting.
- Calls on all parties to cooperate with UNAMA and ensure the security and freedom of movement of its staff.
- Calls on the Afghan Government and international community to address the threat posed by the Taliban, Al-Qaida, and other extremist groups.
- Encourages confidence-building measures between Afghanistan and its neighbours.
- Requests the Secretary-General to report to the Council every six months on developments in Afghanistan.
- Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
